creator: MattAuSupport

content:
You don't login into Thunderbird. You do login to your email provider's server via Thunderbird. Hence you cannot change your account password via Thunderbird. You'd have to login to your account via webmail, and change the password on the server. Thunderbird will prompt you for a password whenever one is needed. You can tell Thunderbird to remember your account password, so that you don't have to type it again and again.

Can you login to your account via webmail?
creator: christ1

content:
Okay. It took me a little while to find some of the stuff you were referencing, but I think I turned off threading everywhere, at least for now. I hope this holds with the next iteration of 115.

I can only hope the Thunderbird team will soon make this an option any user can easily find on a menu and just turn it off. Whoever thought it was a good idea to impose automatic threading on us all made a big, big mistake.

content: I fully agree. Be sure to reread the tip about creating a user.js file, as that can ensure that any future installation of Thunderbird defaults to unthreaded.

content: In Settings>General you can specify to not automatically install updates. Thunderbird does not ask for account information unless you previously set the account up. Thunderbird is just a messenger, reporting back to the user the requests being received from the server.

I am blown away that Thunderbird can't automatically make an image VIEWABLE! I can see like 10-20% of it, this surely must be a problem for millions of people. creator: christ1

content:
christ1 said
What is your anti-virus software?

Anti-virus and anti-malware = built-in Microsoft Security Essentials; Anti-malware = Spybot and CCleaner

(I should mention that I never had this problem while using previous Thunderbird versions, for many years -- and I haven't changed anti-virus or anti-malware programs since moving to this newest Tbird version.)
creator: maberly2

content:
- exit the OS - go to profile folder and locate the account, either under Imapmail folder or Mail folder - look for file named msgfilterrules.dat within the account - copy as desired to same location on other machine.

This is a plain text file, so you can review it or change if needed.
creator: davidsk

content: highlight the unified inbox folder, rightclick and select properties, then click 'choose' and tick the missing inbox.
